sub_title: Global Technical Product Owner - Digital/DAM at JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS
summary:
Ever since my days as a literary scholar and teacher I have been deeply fascinated with content and how it changes with time. I decided to pursue my passion for content further subsequent to my return to business.

I am a storyteller at heart and an avid user of both the left and right side of my brain. I possess a strong eye for producing visual assets and a good commercial nose, with an ability to think outside the box. I am passionate and curious about all aspects of digital marketing and strive to create impactful digital assets on all platforms using excellent writing and editing skills, along with my knowledge of creative design tools and web technologies.

My transition from research of 19th century popular literature to production of 21st century digital content has further underlined my conviction that content needs to reflect the wants of its audience and adapt swiftly to the changes thereof in order for it to be appealing, particularly in this rapidly changing digital age of social, local, and mobile access.

Outside of the office, I can be found reading a good book over a cappuccino in my favorite cafeteria, or at home enjoying an umphteenth rewatch of movies such as the classic Star Wars trilogy, Predator, Enter the Dragon, etc. Recently I have also rekindled my childhood passion for creating visuals: photography and drawing.

◆Areas of expertise: project coordination, content production/ optimization/ strategy, digital media, social media/ digital marketing, creative writing, proofreading/ editing, market trends, stakeholder engagement, research/ analysis, teaching/ mentoring

treasury_media.title: SAFe 5 Product Owner Product Manager Certification
treasury_media.description: A Certified SAFe® Product Owner/Product Manager is a SAFe professional who works with customers and development organizations to identify and prioritize requirements.

profile_positions.description:
Continuing the role of digital product manager with increased emphasis on identifying gaps in customer experience; analyzing the current customer journeys, defining transformation and improvement opportunities, and work cross-functionally to create roadmaps that support the organization's CX strategy.

Additionally responsible for the development, oversight, and management of Nikon Europe's enterprise digital asset management (DAM) strategy.
profile_positions.title: CX Specialist (& Digital Asset Manager)

profile_positions.description:
Assumed the additional responsibilities of a digital product manager, amalgamating the existing ones, through promotion.

Selected Achievements:

✔ Key stakeholder in Nikon Europe’s Digital Transformation project; transition to a unified Pan-European cloud-based DXP (digital experience platform) with migration to a best-in-class enterprise DAM (digital asset management) solution, integrating all local market solutions, effectively eliminating all technical debt by the end of 2022 (IT modernization)
✔ Project lead for Phases 1 and 2; led 20+ discovery and definition workshops which involved 35+ pan-European cross-functional stakeholders, resulting in 14 web page templates and 79 web components for Phase 1; main decision-maker on wireframes, designs, and functional specifications
✔ Responsible for the development, oversight, and management of the replacement DAM solution, from RFP to configuration; established and implemented an enterprise digital asset cataloging and metadata standards strategy ensuring secure storage, efficient search, retrieval and repurposing of digital content
✔ Implemented website requirements for 34 major product launches (e.g. 5 mirrorless cameras, 16 mirrorless lenses, not including accessories), creating mock-ups, wireframes, story boards, and user stories; included 3 high-profile Pan-European live product launch events
profile_positions.title: Web Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Acted as the liaison between product, marketing, ecommerce, and technology teams to understand customer demand for new features and prioritize the product roadmap to ensure the goals of Nikon’s digital strategy were achieved. Owned the product content lifecycle from launch to end-of-life across the 40 European corporate sites for Nikon’s Imaging and Sport Optics products, including accessories, apps and services.

Selected Achievements:

✔ Implemented website requirements for 22 major product launches (e.g. 2 DSLR cameras, 1 mirrorless camera, 2 specialty video kits, 7 mirrorless lenses, not including accessories), creating mock-ups, wireframes, story boards, and user stories
✔ Drove continual evolution and enhancement of digital customer journeys, particularly for Nikon’s mirrorless products, leading to a 74% spike in the first month of improvement and 27% increase of monthly organic visitors for cameras thereafter which remained stable despite the rapidly decreasing camera market; lenses showed a steady increase in organic traffic
✔ Established and maintained a clear insight into the expiration of usage rights of visual assets of over 500 imaging products within Nikon’s digital asset management system, nullifying penalties
✔ Collaborated closely with Web Specialist (external consultant) to lay the groundwork for the Digital Transformation project
profile_positions.title: Web Content Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Continuing my previous role at Impress Group Singapore Pte. Ltd., working remotely as an independent contractor for IAD, Inc., another one of the operating companies of the Impress Group in Japan.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator / Translator (Independent Contractor)

profile_positions.description:
Played a key role, managing integral aspects of content lifecycle, including content creation (writing, copywriting), optimization (proofreading, editing, fact-checking), monitoring (social media, comments), and evaluation (analysis of web traffic, engagement metrics, social shares, assisted conversions) across various channels to increase market awareness and improve sales. Led full-cycle management of localization projects, from ideation to completion, ensuring execution within time and budget constraints.

Selected Contributions:

✔ Championed a new client (Canon India Pvt. Ltd.) for a 2-year content plan agreement with a budget of USD 100K through key initiatives.
✔ Significantly enhanced client relationships (Canon Singapore Pvt. Ltd., Nikon Singapore Pte Ltd) as the primary point-of-contact for content requirement discussions and issue escalation, guaranteeing that all content portrays and promotes the client's consistent brand voice and achieves high quality standards.
✔ Led the negotiation and approval of quarterly content plan proposals with budgets of USD 25K to 30K monthly, as well as a proposal for a key mobile app upgrade with a budget of USD 60K (Canon Singapore Pvt. Ltd).
✔ Optimized company performance by transforming creative ideas into eye-catching content and pioneered key improvements.
profile_positions.title: Project Coordinator / Translator

profile_positions.description:
Teaching students how to read, write, and speak Japanese at three levels of basic proficiency. Planning, preparing, and delivering coursework for this range of Japanese classes. Conducting six 3-hourly classes per week for up to 180 students per semester. Marking examinations, maintaining student records, and giving appropriate feedback to students. Advising students on research projects and continuing academic endeavors. 
Apart from my teaching duties, research had to be conducted on a regular basis.
profile_positions.title: Japanese Language Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Research was conducted on the literary works by Kyokutei Bakin (曲亭 馬琴, 1767-1848), in particular the epic novel 𝘕𝘢𝘯𝘴ō 𝘚𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘮𝘪 𝘏𝘢𝘬𝘬𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘯 (南総里見八犬伝, "Chronicles of The Eight Dog Warriors of the Satomi", 1814-1842), and other late Kinsei literary works, under supervision of late Ihara Saikaku expert Prof. Taniwaki Masachika (谷脇理史, 1938-2009) initially, and Bakin specialist Prof. Harimoto Shinichi (播本 眞一), which culminated in the 160-page thesis 𝘍𝘶𝘴𝘦-𝘩𝘪𝘮𝘦 𝘯𝘰 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘫𝘪: 𝘕𝘢𝘯𝘴ō 𝘚𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘮𝘪 𝘏𝘢𝘬𝘬𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘯 𝘯𝘪 𝘰𝘬𝘦𝘳𝘶 𝘴𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘣𝘶𝘵𝘴𝘶-𝘴𝘩ū𝘨ō 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘫𝘪-𝘴𝘶𝘪𝘫𝘢𝘬𝘶-𝘴𝘦𝘵𝘴𝘶 (伏姫の本地ー『南総里見八犬伝』に於ける神仏習合と本地垂迹説ー, "Fuse-hime's origin: Shinto-Buddhist syncretism and the theory of honji-suijaku (i.e. the manifestation of Buddhist divine beings as native kami) found in Nansō Satomi Hakkenden", 2012). This thesis attempts to amalgamate existing theories on the divine character of Fuse-hime and to illustrate why the author emphasized her kami nature above all else by identifying the iconography of divine beings found in his literature and their associations as perceived by readers of the period.
Recipient of the Japanese Government (Monbukagakusho: MEXT) Scholarship for Research Students between 2008 and 2012.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

profile_positions.description:
My 'minute of fame', appearing in 2 episodes of the 49th NHK Taiga drama, Ryōmaden (龍馬伝), in the role of Anton L.C. Portman, Dutch interpreter to Commodore Perry during the Perry Expedition to Japan (1853–1854). 
Apart from acting, NHK required me to translate the script of Japanese actor Yoshida Asahi (ヨシダ 朝), who played the role of Hori Tatsunosuke (堀達之助), Japanese interpreter, into Dutch and voice record the script so the actor could memorize the Dutch pronunciation. Shooting of the scenes was conducted at NHK (Japan Broadcasting Corporation) in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan, on 17 September 2009.
This historical fiction television drama was shown on NHK from 3 January to 28 November 2010 spanning 48 episodes.
Appearance in the following episodes:
・Season 1: Ryōma the Dreamer, Episode 5: "Kurofune to ken" (黒船と剣 Black Ship and Sword), aired 31 January 2010
・Season 1: Ryōma the Dreamer, Episode 6: "Shōin wa dokoda?" (松陰はどこだ? Where is Shōin?), aired 7 February 2010

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm9406395/
profile_positions.title: Actor

profile_positions.description:
In charge of implementing the PC Refresh 2007 and RSA SecurID Token Refresh Projects in the EMEA region. The company switched the service contract of their computers to Hewlett-Packard, which required all company staff to send their Dell and IBM hardware to the depot and have them changed. Work consisted of communication with staff and coordination with the depot. On-site setup of new computers was conducted personally at the Wasquehal plant in France and the Northwich plant in the United Kingdom.

Selected Contributions:

✔ Composed, prepared, edited, and distributed correspondence and other department documents
✔ Created & restored workstation OS images, Windows XP / Vista using Symantec Ghost
✔ Installed, configured, tested and maintained computer hardware, software and peripherals according to established guidelines
✔ Provided excellent customer support while providing technical assistance in an efficient yet friendly and patient manner - responded to phone calls, emails, and in-person requests
✔ Quickly adapted to changes in user demands, work environment, and changes to processes or requirements
profile_positions.title: IT Administrative Assistant

profile_positions.description: Dutch-Japanese interpretation at the Sekisui Minakuchi Kako Co. Ltd. resin factory in Kohka city, Shiga prefecture, Japan, during a three month training program for Dutch engineers. Work required adherence to the 12-hour rotating shift schedule of the Japanese staff and interpret questions and explanations about the chemical processes and technical details at the factory.
profile_positions.title: Interpreter
